node.text:
❤️Thank you so much for joining me and taking time to say hello! 

It was so nice to connect with all of you 🥰🌐Sorry, if I have missed some of your questions!! 

Leave a comment if you would like to do more Q&A LIVEs❓

If yes, leave your question below and I will answer it in the next LIVE! 

You guys are amazing!! 

So humbled to be a part of this amazing community!!

𝒳𝒪, 𝒜𝓃𝓎𝒶𝑴𝒐𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒐𝒓𝒊𝑭𝒓𝒐𝒎𝑻𝒉𝒆𝑯𝒆𝒂𝒓𝒕

.
A lot of what we discussed is in my e-book The BASICS ~ The Montessori method parenting book: Birth till Age 6. 

🚨I have a limited time promo code for you for 25% off

Enter promo LIVE

https://montessorifromtheheart.com/product/the-basics-bringing-montessori-home-birth-to-age-six-book/

••••••••••

_____________
#montessoriathome #montessori #homeschool#montessorikids#sensoryplay#homeschooling#preschool#preschoolteacher#preschoolactivities#preschooler
#kindergarten #kindergartenteacher
#learningthroughplay #learningisfun

node.text:
⠀
☑︎ follow @MontessoriFromTheHeart ♡
⠀
————
So many of you are reaching out that your little one cannot sustain attention on one activity for long and that is totally OK ! Actually, the attention span of a child about is about 2 to 3 minutes per year, so
- a 2 yr’s engagement can be expected to 📉wind down after about ⏱5 min🤩
- 4 yr after about 10 min, etc.
⠀
HOW TO PROLONG IT❓
INCORPORATE 🏃🏽 MOVEMENT‼️
⠀
Recent research actually suggests that children are learning MORE while actively moving rather than when passively sitting 🪑 and thus MOVEMENT is indispensable for a healthy development of a young child as whole: physically, cognitively, and emotionally! So let’s get moving!!
⠀
🚨Have you joined Montessori MADE EASY Membership 👉🏻
⠀
https://montessorifromtheheart.com/product/homeschool-montessori-made-easy-membership/
⠀
𝒳𝒪, 𝒜𝓃𝓎𝒶𝑴𝒐𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒐𝒓𝒊𝑭𝒓𝒐𝒎𝑻𝒉𝒆𝑯𝒆𝒂𝒓𝒕
⠀
♥︎ Double tap ♡ if you ♥️
♥︎ SAVE 🗂 👉🏻|⊼ bottom/right
♥︎ SHARE 🌐👉🏻paper ✈️ ⩥ [next to ♡]
♥︎ TRY 🏷 Tag me & I will feature you in MY 📺 Stories!
⠀
_____________

#finemotorskills#homeschool #montessori #homeschooling
#preschool#preschoolteacher#preschooler
#kindergarten #kindergartenteacher
#learningthroughplay

node.text:
#Montessori Practical Life
⠀
☑︎ follow @MontessoriFromTheHeart ♡
————
Details on my 📃blog
⠀
 https://montessorifromtheheart.com/2016/10/11/the-cycle-of-an-apple-and-apple-serving-activity/
⠀
•••••••••
Dr. Maria Montessori through her scientific observation came to a conclusion that children are naturally curious and seek to participate in daily life activities they see all around them. They innately want to feel useful, helpful and contributing members of the family. “Help me do it myself!” Proclaims a child bursting with confidence and enthusiasm!  And so she developed practical life exercises to give children an opportunity to develop and master important practical life skills, gain independence and become fully functional members of the family and community.
⠀
💡 You can start as early as 15 M with simple activities such as cleaning fruits or veggies or loading laundry. Trust me, your little one is capable of great skills if given an opportunity to DO THE DOING!
⠀
⠀

node.text:
⚖️ 🔵🟡🟣🔴🟢GROSS MOTOR FUN
⠀
☑︎ follow @MontessoriFromTheHeart ♡
————
So many of you are reaching out that your little one cannot sustain attention on one activity for long and that is totally OK ! Actually, the attention span of a child about is about 2 to 3 minutes per year and did you know that most children need movement!!! Recent research actually suggests that children are learning more while actively moving rather than when passively sitting 🪑 And PE (physical exercise) breaks are absolutely indispensable for a healthy development of a child as whole: physically, cognitively, and emotionally! So let’s get moving!!
⠀
⠀
𝒳𝒪, 𝒜𝓃𝓎𝒶𝑴𝒐𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒐𝒓𝒊𝑭𝒓𝒐𝒎𝑻𝒉𝒆𝑯𝒆𝒂𝒓𝒕

☑︎ follow @MontessoriFromTheHeart ♡
————
So many of you have requested, so I am sharing our learning space, as well as how I store and organize materials.
⠀
Please note, you do NOT need a big room or a lot of materials to embrace Montessori! (What you see, is the accumulation of nearly 10 years!) I started with a small corner shelf in an apartment’s enclosed balcony! And it was ENOUGH to bring the joy of learning and make our homeschooling center on the CHILD! It’s not about the size or quantity of things you have, it’s about the METHOD and YOUR desire to make it happen! Do NOT let anything stop 🛑 you! And I am here to help if you have any questions ❓
⠀

node.text:
🌳STAMP and 🍎 COUNT
@MontessoriFromTheHeart ♡
——
🚨Have you joined Montessori MADE-EASY Membership❓If you sign up today, you will still get access to entire 🌊 OCEAN & 🐢TURTLE studies! 🍏🍎Apple theme 👉🏻 is next!
•••••••••
Isn’t counting fun❓As long as it’s NOT done in a workbook 📕 😆Remember, ACTIVE learning is more effective than passive! When our state of mind 🧠 is engaged through hands-in manipulation, children naturally develop strong synapses!
⠀
Here your child is reinforcing RATIONAL counting while developing fine motor control and hand-eye coordination!
⠀
YOU’LL NEED:
- a paper roll
- markers
- a peg
- a pom pom
- paint 🎨 (you can make it 🍒🍎 🍐 or 🌺🌸blooms)
⠀
AGE: 2 YR+⚠️Always supervise your child!
————
💡 🔢Rote Counting vs. Rational Counting:
⠀
The difference between rote and rational counting is that the first is a process of sequentially memorizing number names and the second is the process of understanding the value of numbers. If a child is only able to recite numbers in order, just like a heart-learned-poem, it by no means indicates the actual mathematical understanding of numbers. It is thus important, that once a child is able to count to 5 or 10, to shift focus from making that number bigger to making sure that a child can reliably count a small number of manipulatives and assign that quantitative sum to a numeral. Trust me, 1:1 correspondence is a much better indication of your child’s mathematical mastery than a long list of memorized numbers. And the best part, you can introduce 1:1 correspondence starting at an early age by modeling through real-life manipulative and hands-on DIYs. Invite your child to TOUCH each object and provide various hands-on invitations to count, by offering beads, buttons, loose items, blocks, Lego pieces, food items, etc. Make sure that experiences is fun and engaging in order to sustain curiosity and develop the love for numbers and math.
⠀
𝒳𝒪, 𝒜𝓃𝓎𝒶𝑴𝒐𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒐𝒓𝒊𝑭𝒓𝒐𝒎𝑻𝒉𝒆𝑯𝒆𝒂𝒓𝒕
_____________

node.text:
Becoming a Montessorian …
 @MontessoriFromTheHeart ♡
———
Do fears hold you back? What about doubt, uncertainty or the feeling of overwhelming transformation that seems unachievable and even less doable?
⠀

Well, let me tell you! There is nothing you cannot do if you set your heart to it!!

Instead of …  think 

I don’t know enough …  I can learn

The materials are pricy … there are a lot of DIY options 

I don’t have space …. I have a shelf

I don’t have time … I find time to do things that are important

I am not qualified … I have a desire to do it and I will! 

I am afraid to fail … just by worrying about it, you will NOT! 

I am not enough … you are enough! 

No one knows your child better than you do! And during the Absorbent Mind plane, they need YOU and a thoughtfully prepared ENVIRONMENT where they can thrive, absorb, incarnate and grow to their fullest potentials!!
 
Tell me your story 💕

𝒳𝒪, 𝒜𝓃𝓎𝒶𝑴𝒐𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒐𝒓𝒊𝑭𝒓𝒐𝒎𝑻𝒉𝒆𝑯𝒆𝒂𝒓𝒕
⠀
_____________

node.text:
🌊 OCEANIC ZONES
 @MontessoriFromTheHeart ♡
———
As we are finishing up the OCEAN study, we are exploring the mysteries of the deep see! These lessons are captivating, intriguing and open a trillion of invitations to learn and play! And here is an easy and hands-on way to learn about the Oceanic  Pelagic Zones.
⠀
⠀
YOU’LL NEED:
- felts
- marine animals (we are using multiple of @safariltd TOOBs - swipe up from my stories for 15% off(
- Montessori color tablets Box 3 or paint 🎨 samples
⠀
AGE: 3 yo+ ⚠️Always supervise your child!
⠀
———
💡 WHY HANDS-ON LEARNING?
⠀
It allows little people to engage in kinesthetic learning. By experimenting with trial and error, children learn from their mistakes, thus understanding the potential gap between theory and practice. 🙌🏻Hands-on learning is the common name for ‘Experiential Learning’ - the philosophical term behind the method of immersing oneself in a process in order to learn it. Experiential Learning has been around since 350 BCE, when Aristotle wrote, "for the things we have to learn before we can do them, we learn by doing them". This method had ultimately became popular in the early 1950's when famous  psychologists such as Jean Piaget, John Dewey and Kurt Lewin shed some 💡 light on Experiential Learning, quickly making it a staple in American education.
⠀
HOW TO EMBRACE IT? Let your child DO THE DOING! Offer them to SORT and CLASSIFY, MANIPULATE and TRANSFER, MAKE and CREATE! A child can NOT ‘do the doing’ unless they have been given an opportunity to actually DO IT!
⠀
⠀
𝒳𝒪, 𝒜𝓃𝓎𝒶𝑴𝒐𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒐𝒓𝒊𝑭𝒓𝒐𝒎𝑻𝒉𝒆𝑯𝒆𝒂𝒓𝒕
⠀
♥︎ Double tap ♡ if you ♥️
♥︎ SAVE 🗂 👉🏻|⊼ bottom/right
♥︎ SHARE 🌐👉🏻paper ✈️ ⩥ [next to ♡]
⠀
_____________

node.text:
🐢Paper Plate Crafts (Toddler-Friendly)
 @MontessoriFromTheHeart ♡
⠀
Get a FREE 🐢body cut-outs 📥PDF from my stories 💕
———
Montessori Cultural unit studies are by far the most requested by my children (and my members) and crafts make learning opportunities even more fun!! And if we can involve even the youngest members of homeschooling families, then it’s a total win-win!! Besides you’re using recyclable items around your home and no specialized craft materials are required!!
⠀
Which one do you like better❓
1️⃣ Brown paper packaging or
2️⃣ Buttons tissue paper
⠀
And can you tell which 🐢coloring was Adrian‘s and which one was Julia’s? They each had a set to color the sea turtle body-parts.
⠀
P.S. 👧🏻Julia ✍🏻 hand-drew these body cut outs! She definitely has an artistic side and a patience to do it!💕
⠀
And don’t forget to check my stories for this PDF that I offer for a limited time!
⠀
⠀
SKILLs ✅:
-🖐🏻 hand 👁 eye coordination
- fine motor control
- learning through play while fostering imagination and creativity
——
AGE 2 Y+ ⚠️Always supervise your child!
⠀
••••••••••••••••
💡Crafting and painting is very important for early childhood development since it helps the body and brain to integrate tactile information in a creative way. Process art is perfect for little artists since the focus lies in the creation of the work, not the outcome! During this fun artistic process, your child learns how colors work, while developing spatial awareness and sensory integration. And it’s FUN!!!
⠀
⠀
 𝒳𝒪, 𝒜𝓃𝓎𝒶𝑴𝒐𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒐𝒓𝒊𝑭𝒓𝒐𝒎𝑻𝒉𝒆𝑯𝒆𝒂𝒓𝒕
⠀
⠀
_____________

#finemotorskills#homeschool #montessori #homeschooling
#preschool#preschoolteacher
#preschoolactivities#preschooler
#kindergarten #kindergartenteacher

node.text:
🔄Lifecycle of a Sea turtle 🐢
 @MontessoriFromTheHeart ♡
——
Here is a hands-on activity to learn the lifecycle of a sea turtle 🐢 ! My Montessori Made-Easy members can download the entire life cycle e-Book or you can Google the images or even drawn!
⠀
YOU’LL NEED:
- sensory bin filler for sand and water
- wooden 🪵 slices
- printable
- lifecycle figurines
⠀
 HOW:  invite your child to assemble the life cycle in order 🐢
⠀
⚠️chocking hazards!! Small pieces!
•••••••••
💡 WHY HANDS-ON LEARNING?
⠀
It allows little people to engage in kinesthetic learning by doing! 🙌🏻’Hands-on learning’ is the common name for ‘Experiential Learning’ - the philosophical term behind the method of immersing oneself in a process in order to learn it. Experiential Learning has been around since 350 BCE, when Aristotle wrote, "for the things we have to learn before we can do them, we learn by doing them". Most importantly, hands-on learning is uniquely positioned to support or elevate ANY type of learner! Best of all, research has proven that children who learn using hands-on methods with manipulatives, outperform those who are not. What are manipulatives? They are physical tools engaging children visually and physically with objects such as figurines, blocks, loose items, etc. The use of manipulatives is constructive because little people are actively engaged  in discovery by TOUCHING, TRANSFERRING & MANIPULATING during the learning process.
⠀
𝒳𝒪, 𝒜𝓃𝓎𝒶𝑴𝒐𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒐𝒓𝒊𝑭𝒓𝒐𝒎𝑻𝒉𝒆𝑯𝒆𝒂𝒓𝒕
⠀
_____________
#montessoriathome #montessori #kidsactivities#finemotorskills#sensoryplay#homeschool#preschool#preschoolteacher#preschooler #kindergarten#learningthroughplay#invitationtoplay #homeschooling

node.text:
DIY 📦 TACTILE MATCHING BOARD 🧩
 @MontessoriFromTheHeart ♡
——
Montessori tactile ~ also called ‘touch’ boards or tablets are designed to refine the sense of ✋🏻 touch. Such materials create a conscious awareness of the texture of the surface. Dr. Maria Montessori called this “An education of the hand.” That is a hand, which can touch lightly while internalizing and classifying the information about the texture, is able to write ✍🏻 later without pressing hard into the paper.
⠀
YOU’LL NEED:
- 📦 recycled cardboard
- hot glue gun
- use contrasting textures (I used 🌈 rice 🍚, pebbles, millet and salt)
- recycled milk or water caps (for matching 🧩)
⠀
 HOW:  invite your child to touch different textures very lightly with the tips of the fingers and then match the corresponding caps.
⠀
⠀
𝒳𝒪, 𝒜𝓃𝓎𝒶𝑴𝒐𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒐𝒓𝒊𝑭𝒓𝒐𝒎𝑻𝒉𝒆𝑯𝒆𝒂𝒓𝒕
⠀

node.text:
AVOID JUDGMENT & EMPTY PRAISE
 @MontessoriFromTheHeart ♡
——
As Dr. Maria Montessori‘s 🎂 birthday is approaching, I would like to give some of her amazing insights a permanent place on my feed!
⠀
Ok! I was guilty as charged, as a newly parent, telling my first child “great job!” a 1000 times🤦‍♀️! The reason in a Montessori environment we try to avoid “good job” or “you are the best!” is because it casts judgment! Trust me, your little one is NOT doing anything in her/his daily routeen in search of adult’s praise! They just ARE: being, experiencing, absorbing! They fold towels or clean vegetables or water plants because it is of interest to THEM! They want to DO IT! They need to experience through ‘work’ in order to grow!
⠀
So when we place labels such as good or bad upon something your child is performing in order to satisfy their OWN developmental needs (remember they’re not trying to impress you!), we take the ownership AWAY from them! What they do - all of a sudden- becomes about US and what WE think!
⠀
⠀
 “Praise, help, or even a look, maybe enough to interrupt [a child] or destroy the activity. It seems a strange thing to say, but this can happen even if the child merely becomes aware of being watched. After all, we too sometimes feel unable to go on working if someone comes to see what we are doing. The great principle which brings success to the teacher is this: as soon as concentration has begun, act as if the child does not exist. Naturally, one can see what he is doing with a quick glance, but without his being aware of it.” (Dr. Maria Montessori. The Absorbent Mind.)
⠀
In fact, studies show that overusing phrases like ‘good job’ or ‘I am so proud of you!’ can actually hurt children’s self-esteem!
⠀
Thus, be mindful, sincere and specific and instead of overpraising, judging, or criticizing, bring a child's awareness to the reality of OWN behavior in order to promote self-control.
⠀
What are your alternatives to commonly overused phrases❓
⠀
 𝒳𝒪, 𝒜𝓃𝓎𝒶𝑴𝒐𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒐𝒓𝒊𝑭𝒓𝒐𝒎𝑻𝒉𝒆𝑯𝒆𝒂𝒓𝒕
⠀
_____________
#montessoriathome#montessoritoddler #sensoryplay
#finemotorskills#homeschool #montessori #homeschooling
#preschool#preschoolteacher

node.text:
🍁🍂AUTUM 🌳 BRUSH 🎨CRAFT
 @MontessoriFromTheHeart ♡
⠀
Details & free printable on my blog 📃
https://montessorifromtheheart.com/2020/09/15/autumn-tree-dish-brush-painting/
—————
So, here is a 🖐🏻 HANDS-ON way [literally 😜] to discuss the change of seasons and all the beautiful 🍂🍁 foliage! You can also modify this craft for spring or summer!
⠀
And messy not so messy form of art is creative, education, and amazing to develop fine motor control and dexterity!
⠀
YOU’ll NEED:
- a Season 🌳Tree 📥printout (go to my 📃blog)
- 🎨paints (bio glitter is optional)
- a small brush
⠀
SKILLs ✅:
-🖐🏻 hand 👁 eye coordination
- fine motor control
- learning through play while fostering imagination and creativity
——
AGE 1 Y+ ⚠️Always supervise your child!
••••••••••••••••
💡Messy play like finger painting is very important for early childhood development since it helps the body and brain to integrate tactile information in a creative way. Process art is perfect for little artists since the focus lies in the creation of the work, not the outcome! During this fun artistic process, your child learns how colors work, especially color mixing, while developing spatial awareness and sensory integration. And it’s FUN!!!
⠀
⠀
 𝒳𝒪, 𝒜𝓃𝓎𝒶𝑴𝒐𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒐𝒓𝒊𝑭𝒓𝒐𝒎𝑻𝒉𝒆𝑯𝒆𝒂𝒓𝒕
⠀
⠀
⠀
_____________
#montessoriathome#montessoritoddler #sensoryplay
#finemotorskills#homeschool #montessori #homeschooling
#preschool#preschoolteacher#preschoolactivities#preschooler
#kindergarten #kindergartenteacher
#learningthroughplay#kidsactivities

node.text:
🐘 🦒🦓🦩🐢ANIMALS SKIN MATCH
 @MontessoriFromTheHeart ♡
———
🚨Download 🦒SKIN MATCH Members 📥 from MAIN PORTAL under BABY
⠀
If I were to prioritize learning, I would say workbooks are at the bottom of the totem pole. And hands-on SORTING, MATCHING and MANIPULATING are on 🔝🙌🏻! Nothing beats it!
⠀
Actually animals skin matching is one of the very first sensorial activities you can introduce to 18 months old. This activity is present in almost every single Montessori classroom and I am so happy to offer it to my members!
———
💡 WHY HANDS-ON LEARNING?
⠀
It allows little people to engage in kinesthetic learning. By experimenting with trial and error, children learn from their mistakes, thus understanding the potential gap between theory and practice. 🙌🏻Hands-on learning is the common name for ‘Experiential Learning’ - the philosophical term behind the method of immersing oneself in a process in order to learn it. Experiential Learning has been around since 350 BCE, when Aristotle wrote, "for the things we have to learn before we can do them, we learn by doing them". This method had ultimately became popular in the early 1950's when famous  psychologists such as Jean Piaget, John Dewey and Kurt Lewin shed some 💡 light on Experiential Learning, quickly making it a staple in American education.
⠀
HOW TO EMBRACE IT? Let your child DO THE DOING! Offer them to SORT and CLASSIFY, MANIPULATE and TRANSFER, MAKE and CREATE! A child can NOT ‘do the doing’ unless they have been given an opportunity to actually DO IT!
⠀
⠀
𝒳𝒪, 𝒜𝓃𝓎𝒶𝑴𝒐𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒐𝒓𝒊𝑭𝒓𝒐𝒎𝑻𝒉𝒆𝑯𝒆𝒂𝒓𝒕
⠀
♥︎ Double tap ♡ if you ♥️
♥︎ SAVE 🗂 👉🏻|⊼ bottom/right
♥︎ SHARE 🌐👉🏻paper ✈️ ⩥ [next to ♡]
⠀

node.text:
😋TASTE-SAFE 🌊PLAY FOAM 🐠 🧲
 @MontessoriFromTheHeart ♡
———
Bringing back PLAY FOAM but even better! TASTE-SAFE! No soap 🧼 needed!!
⠀
And tomorrow it will be 97 F+ 🥵and water play - foamy or 🧊 frozen -  is my kids absolute favorite sensory medium!!!And if you add food coloring, you can have a FUN #invitationtoplay which is a perfect messy not so messy alternative if your little one does not like anything slimy or sticky! 🥴
⠀
HOW FOAM:
- 2 drained cans of cheap peas liquid
-  1/4 tsp of cream of tartar
- add 1 drop of 💙food coloring (too much will stain 🙌🏻 hands)
 - whisk well (electric works best!)
⠀
HOW FISH:
- 🐠ice mold
-water and food coloring
- paper clips
- magnet 🧲
•••••••••
💡 We are playing along with OCEAN 🌊 theme but do add what ever water proof figurines you have! How about 🚗 car wash or dinosaurs rescue from mud, or unicorns 🦄 in 🌈 foam or giving dolls a bath 🛁 !
⠀
Play foam is amazing to touch! It feels fluffy, soft and smells amazing! Let me know if you tried it!
•••••••
SKILLs:
-🖐🏻 hand 👁 eye coordination
-fine motor control (using tongs)
- also gross motor control when children learn to coordinate larger group muscles
- tactile stimulation
————
AGE 12M+ ⚠️Always supervise your child! This play foam is edible (skip all the extras 📎🐠 for really little ones!)
⠀
••••••••••••
❓food coloring will NOT a permanently stain hands or clothes as LONG AS YOU DON’T USE TOO MUCH
❓have a hose or a portable sink or another rinse 🚿 option nearby
‼️the MESS is SO worth the FUN🤩
⠀
𝒳𝒪, 𝒜𝓃𝓎𝒶𝑴𝒐𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒐𝒓𝒊𝑭𝒓𝒐𝒎𝑻𝒉𝒆𝑯𝒆𝒂𝒓𝒕
⠀
♥︎ Double tap ♡ if you ♥️
♥︎ SAVE 🗂 👉🏻|⊼ bottom/right
♥︎ SHARE 🌐👉🏻paper ✈️ ⩥ [next to ♡]
⠀

node.text:
FLOATING 🆙 BEADS
 @Montessori From The Heart ♡
———
🧪 So many of you are asking for MORE #STEM activities! So here we go! This is definitely a WOW 😯 one!
⠀
YOU’LL NEED:
- 2 bottles with narrow spouts
- fusible beads (see my stories for a link)
- water 💧
- heavy card-stock (I am using a paint 🎨sample)
⠀
We have done the magic paper UPSIDE DOWN trick before! See my 📃blog  for science 🧪 mystery revealed 👉🏻
⠀
https://montessorifromtheheart.com/2019/09/09/upside-down-water-glass-trick/
⠀
•••••••••••
 💡 Try this experiment using various types of PAPER. Try changing the amount of water in the cup. Also, try different containers. Does it make any difference❓Will a wider cup hold the paper better than a narrower cup? Does the temperature of the water have any effect on the water staying inside the cup? Let me know in 💬comments!
⠀
🤔Did you know that #stemeducation stimulates 🧠 cognitive development, develops problem- solving skills, encourages experimentation, teamwork and more! So let’s bring stem home through easy to conduct and fun science 🧪 experiments!
————
AGE 4Y+ ⚠️Always supervise your children while they are learning through play!
⠀
𝒳𝒪, 𝒜𝓃𝓎𝒶𝑴𝒐𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒐𝒓𝒊𝑭𝒓𝒐𝒎𝑻𝒉𝒆𝑯𝒆𝒂𝒓𝒕
⠀
